body.p:
Hartford Ky Oct 7th/64
Gov Bramlette
Dear Sir

Capt Westerfield I understand is under arrest at Frankfort -- charged with shipping negroes across the Ohio river and disposing of them -- & destroying papers of citizens -- Now sir I believe all those charges are false & I hope you will at least give him a speedy trial upon those charges
He & his Co have been very active in keeping out the guerrillas in our county & if he has erred it has been in favor of Union Men & against Guerrillas & their friends

It is true he has pressed horses while in the pursuit of Guerrillas but he has I think in every instance returned them I will venture the assertion that no good Union man has ever complained of him -- his opposers are secesh and copperheads or union men with wooll in their teeth

Hartford Ky
Oct 7" 1864 --
Harrison J. J.
To the Gov --
Believes all charges against Capt Westerfield who is a Frankfort under arrest -- to be false. hopes that he may have a speedy trial --
